018
019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util;
020
021import io.kubernetes.client.common.KubernetesListObject;
022import io.kubernetes.client.common.KubernetesObject;
023import io.kubernetes.client.custom.V1Patch;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
026import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ConfigMap;
027import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ConfigMapList;
028import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
029import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1PersistentVolumeClaim;
030import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1PersistentVolumeClaimList;
031import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1Pod;
032import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1PodList;
033import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.GenericKubernetesApi;
034import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.DeleteOptions;
035import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.PatchOptions;
036import java.util.Optional;
037
038/**
039 * Helpers for K8s API.
040 */
041@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.ShortClassName", "PMD.UseUtilityClass" })
042public class K8s {
043
044    /**
045     * Given a groupVersion, returns only the version.
046     *
047     * @param groupVersion the group version
048     * @return the string
049     */
050    public static String version(String groupVersion) {
051        return groupVersion.substring(groupVersion.lastIndexOf('/') + 1);
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Get PVC API.
056     *
057     * @param client the client
058     * @return the generic kubernetes api
059     */
060    public static GenericKubernetesApi<V1PersistentVolumeClaim,
061            V1PersistentVolumeClaimList> pvcApi(ApiClient client) {
062        return new GenericKubernetesApi<>(V1PersistentVolumeClaim.class,
063            V1PersistentVolumeClaimList.class, "", "v1",
064            "persistentvolumeclaims", client);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Get config map API.
069     *
070     * @param client the client
071     * @return the generic kubernetes api
072     */
073    public static GenericKubernetesApi<V1ConfigMap,
074            V1ConfigMapList> cmApi(ApiClient client) {
075        return new GenericKubernetesApi<>(V1ConfigMap.class,
076            V1ConfigMapList.class, "", "v1", "configmaps", client);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Get pod API.
081     *
082     * @param client the client
083     * @return the generic kubernetes api
084     */
085    public static GenericKubernetesApi<V1Pod, V1PodList>
086            podApi(ApiClient client) {
087        return new GenericKubernetesApi<>(V1Pod.class, V1PodList.class, "",
088            "v1", "pods", client);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Get an object from its metadata.
093     *
094     * @param <T> the generic type
095     * @param <LT> the generic type
096     * @param api the api
097     * @param meta the meta
098     * @return the object
099     */
100    public static <T extends KubernetesObject, LT extends KubernetesListObject>
101            Optional<T>
102            get(GenericKubernetesApi<T, LT> api, V1ObjectMeta meta) {
103        var response = api.get(meta.getNamespace(), meta.getName());
104        if (response.isSuccess()) {
105            return Optional.of(response.getObject());
106        }
107        return Optional.empty();
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Delete an object.
112     *
113     * @param <T> the generic type
114     * @param <LT> the generic type
115     * @param api the api
116     * @param object the object
117     */
118    public static <T extends KubernetesObject, LT extends KubernetesListObject>
119            void delete(GenericKubernetesApi<T, LT> api, T object)
120                    throws ApiException {
121        api.delete(object.getMetadata().getNamespace(),
122            object.getMetadata().getName()).throwsApiException();
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Delete an object.
127     *
128     * @param <T> the generic type
129     * @param <LT> the generic type
130     * @param api the api
131     * @param object the object
132     */
133    public static <T extends KubernetesObject, LT extends KubernetesListObject>
134            void delete(GenericKubernetesApi<T, LT> api, T object,
135                    DeleteOptions options) throws ApiException {
136        api.delete(object.getMetadata().getNamespace(),
137            object.getMetadata().getName(), options).throwsApiException();
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Apply the given patch data.
142     *
143     * @param <T> the generic type
144     * @param <LT> the generic type
145     * @param api the api
146     * @param existing the existing
147     * @param update the update
148     * @throws ApiException the api exception
149     */
150    public static <T extends KubernetesObject, LT extends KubernetesListObject>
151            T apply(GenericKubernetesApi<T, LT> api, T existing, String update)
152                    throws ApiException {
153        PatchOptions opts = new PatchOptions();
154        opts.setForce(true);
155        opts.setFieldManager("kubernetes-java-kubectl-apply");
156        var response = api.patch(existing.getMetadata().getNamespace(),
157            existing.getMetadata().getName(), V1Patch.PATCH_FORMAT_APPLY_YAML,
158            new V1Patch(update), opts).throwsApiException();
159        return response.getObject();
160    }
161
162}
